bibl.title: Military Orders for Rafael T. Echeverria, June 15, 1900

div1.p: Special Orders #88 directs Echeverria to temporary duty in Havana, Cuba. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Rafael T. Echeverria, June 15, 1900
div1.p:
Adjutant General's
OFFICE.
JUN 29 1900
ROLLS DIVISION.
[unclear]

ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
RECD. JUN 25 1900

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 175 A 1900

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, June 15, 1900.

1. Major Rafael Echeverría, Surgeon, U. S. Volunteers, is
relieved from duty as Attending Surgeon to Quartermaster's
employes, and will report without delay to the Command-
ing General, Department of Havana and Pinar del Rio, for
temporary duty.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

2. Major Orlando Ducker, Surgeon, U. S. Volunteers, is
relieved from special duty in the office of the Chief Sur-
geon of the Division, and will report without delay to the
Commanding General, Department of Havana and Pinar
del Rio, for temporary duty.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

3. Acting Assistant Surgeon E. B. Barnet, U. S. Army,
in addition to his present duties, will attend the Quarter-
master's employes at the Corral.

BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:
H. L. SCOTT,
Acting Adjutant General.
